result.execSummary:
The defendant Lesleyire Kirk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.

Def in person & by Atty John Kenyatta Riley.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth appeared for State. Agreement reached. On State's motion, charge amended to two counts of misdemeanor theft per Wis. Stats. 943.20(1)(b)(3)(a), Wis. Stats. Def pleads guilty to count #1 as amended and guilty to count #2 as amended; def is convicted and sentenced.
